page.title: 15Buildings Littlebourne Area
page.content: The age of buildings varies from the timber framed Elbridge 15th C, Tudor Cottage 1596 with its crow stepped chimney to modern bungalows. Most characteristic are the soft red brick houses with peg tiled roofs + string courses built in the 1630-60 period with bricks from the Archbishops Palace at Bekesbourne e.g. the cottages on the green, Swanton Farm, Old Waterways Cottage. Also of this period are the flemish gables seen on Higham, The Old Vicarage, The Anchor + Post Office. There are several terraces of the 19th C. early and late, Edwardian tiling + 1920's type development along Jubilee Road. There are 4 main developments of modern houses + bungalows, one built in the garden of the Old Rectory, the others on orchards. Postwar houses were built on the Hill to replace bombed ones.
